summary: This bill, the Master Sergeant Roddie Edmonds Congressional Gold Medal Act, aims to award a Congressional Gold Medal posthumously to Master Sergeant Roderick Roddie Edmonds. The bill recognizes Edmonds' heroism during World War II when he defied Nazi orders to identify Jewish-American soldiers, saving approximately 200 lives. It details his actions, the historical context, and the process for medal presentation.  The bill also authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to strike and sell bronze duplicates of the gold medal.
